articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
Billionaire hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones, CEO of Tudor Investment Corporation, highlighted the growing threat of inflation in a recent interview with CNBC, describing Bitcoin and gold as essential assets amid rising recession fears in the United States.
 
During the interview, Jones revealed his investment strategy, stating that he is actively purchasing both Bitcoin and gold, positioning himself long in these assets, further reflecting a broader concern about the current economic landscape and the potential consequences of “unchecked government spending.”
 
Jones Urges Investment In Bitcoin And Gold
 
Jones articulated his worries about the US fiscal situation, saying, “We are going to be broke really quickly unless we get serious about dealing with our spending issues.” 
 
Jones w…
articles.title: Paul Tudor Jones Points To Bitcoin And Gold As Shields Against US Inflation Threats

articles.author: Jared Kirui
articles.description:
Stripe plans to acquire the stablecoin infrastructure 
provider Bridge to strengthen its position in the fintech and crypto markets. 
This acquisition is estimated to be valued at $1.1 billion, Forbes reported. According to sources familiar with the matter, 
Stripe's purchase aims to enhance international money transfers and bolster its 
payment solutions for businesses globally. 
The company was founded by John and Patrick Collison 
in 2010 and has established itself in the payment processing sector, with a 
valuation of 65 billion earlier this year.
Expanding Stablecoin Services
Stripe reportedly confirmed the acquisition of Bridge, 
which specializes in enabling businesses to use stablecoins, cryptocurrencies pegged to traditional currencies like the US dollar, for 
transactions.
Bridge has experienced remarkable growth, reporting a 
tenfold increase in business this year alone. CEO Zach Abrams noted the 
company's rapid expansion and its existing clientele, which includes notable 
firms like Coinbase and SpaceX. 
Bridge will reportedly serve as a Web3 version of 
Stripe, enabling seamless payment solutions for digital transactions worldwide. The acquisition comes at a time when digital currencies are gaining 
traction, largely due to recent decisions by the US Securities and Exchange 
Commission (SEC) that have eased regulations surrounding cryptocurrencies. 
This shift has encouraged major companies, including 
PayPal, to embrace digital currencies. PayPal launched its own US dollar 
stablecoin last year.
International Transactions
Although the details about the timeline for the 
acquisition were not disclosed, the move could position Stripe to compete effectively in the digital finance space. By integrating Bridge's capabilities, 
Stripe aims to enhance its offerings and provide businesses with better 
solutions for international transactions.
Expect ongoing updates as this story evolves. 
 

 
This article was written by Jared Kirui at www.financemagnates.com.
articles.title: Stripe to Acquire Stablecoin Startup for Over $1Billion: Report

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
Shiba Inu whale transactions have skyrocketed by a whopping 240%, as large-scale investors have been seen moving trillions of SHIB tokens this week. Considering the significant increase in SHIB whale movements, the price of Shiba Inu could continue its previously halted uptrend to $0.00002.
 
SHIB Whale Activity Spikes
 
New data from IntoTheBlock has shown a massive 269% increase in the Shiba Inu whale transactions. On October 20, the total volume of large-scale transactions by SHIB whales was estimated at 925.79 billion. However, in just one day, whale transaction volume skyrocketed to 3.42 trillion, basically tripling the volume from the previous day. 
 
 
With an average Shiba Inu price of $0.000018, this means that whales have moved over $61.5 million worth of SHIB tokens in just one …
articles.title: Shiba Inu Price Could Resume Uptrend To $0.00002 As Whale Transactions Jump 240% To 3.42 Trillion SHIB

articles.author: Jamie Crawley
articles.description: Not a bank itself, River has teamed up with Lead Bank, a member of the FDIC, meaning users' deposits are protected up to the value of $250,000.
articles.title: Bitcoin Exchange River Financial Allowing Users to Earn BTC Interest on Cash Deposits

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: Avalanche has launched the Avalanche Card, a loadable debit card that allows users to make purchases using their crypto assets where Visa is accepted. The card will initially be available to Latin American and Caribbean residents, excluding specific regions and countries. Avalanche Introduces New Crypto Visa Card for Latin America and the Caribbean The Avalanche […]
articles.title: Avalanche Unleashes a New Way to Spend Crypto: Meet the Avalanche Visa Card

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
The Open Network (TON) blockchain has significantly decreased its daily active users. According to a Twitter/X post by IntoTheBlock, the TON network currently boasts 1.58 million active users, down from a high of over 5 million.
 
The same post also shared a chart tracking the number of daily active addresses on the network, punctuated by highs and lows representing bull and hype runs and market corrections. IntoTheBlock asks: what conditions can potentially trigger TON’s next run?
 
 
TON’s DAU Down, But Does It Matter?
 
IntoTheBlock is just one analytics firm that tracks crypto’s stats, including the daily active users count (DAU). In the fast-growing crypto industry, DAU is a critical metric that can describe the status or even the future of a crypto project. We can think of the DAU as…
articles.title: Boom To Bust: TON Network’s Daily Users Drop From 5 Million To 1.58-M

articles.author: James Van Straten
articles.description: MetaPlanet completes its 11th series of stock acquisition rights, with Evo Fund securing a 14.9% ownership stake after exercising its stock acquisition rights.
articles.title: MetaPlanet Raises $66 Million Through Stocks Acquisition Rights Program

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description: Duquesne Family Office’s Stanley Druckenmiller has revealed his latest move in the U.S. bond market. The billionaire investor who won millions in the past for Duquesne Capital does not believe that inflation will keep cooling down, and is consequently betting that a bond bust will eventually happen. Stanley Druckenmiller Makes a Short Bet Against Current […]
articles.title: Stanley Druckenmiller’s ‘Big Short’ Move: Betting on Future Disaster

articles.author: Krisztian  Sandor
articles.description: The U.S. government's debt and deficit issues aren't going anywhere no matter who wins the presidency next month, said Jones.
articles.title: Paul Tudor Jones: 'All Roads Lead to Inflation,' He's Long Bitcoin and Gold

articles.author: Camomile Shumba
articles.description: The Financial Stability Board identified three vulnerabilities of tokenization: The underlying reference asset; the participants in distributed ledger technology based tokenization projects; and new technology's interaction with legacy systems.
articles.title: Tokenization Could Pose Risks to Financial System, FSB and BIS Warn

articles.author: Jared Kirui
articles.description:
CoinShares opened a new office in New York City,  
expanding its presence in the US market. The company's decision to establish a  
permanent presence in the region followed several major developments, including  
its acquisition of Valkyrie Funds LLC, a digital asset management firm offering  
ETFs. 
Digital Asset Space
According to the official statement, CoinShares’ central  
office in New York City will serve as the base for the company’s US operations,  
which are set to expand rapidly in the coming years. 
The company is reportedly actively recruiting in  
various departments, including sales, marketing, operations, and compliance, to strengthen its presence in the American market and target US institutions with the new base.
Speaking about the new development, Jean-Marie  
Mognetti,…
articles.title: CoinShares Expands US Presence with New York Office

articles.author: Media
articles.description: The 2024 US Election is almost here, and it’s shaking up the market. Traders are speculating on what the outcome will mean for the economy and crypto regulation. But one project encapsulates this, providing a means of speculation while offering hilarious satirical escapades and captivating blockchain innovations. The project is called FreeDum Fighters ($DUM), and […]
articles.title: New Cryptocurrency ICO FreeDum Fighters Raises $225,000 In Opening Weekend

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
On Monday, Coinbase’s Chief Legal Officer, Paul Grewal, announced that the exchange is ramping up its legal efforts in their ongoing battle with US regulators by filing two new sets of Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests. 
 
Grewal emphasized the necessity of obtaining clarity on how regulatory agencies are approaching digital assets, stating, “In short, so long as the government will not relent, neither will Coinbase.”
 
Coinbase Aims To Reveal Crucial Regulatory Communications
 
The first FOIA request seeks documents relating to the cap on digital asset deposits imposed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and other banking regulators on financial institutions.
 
The second request aims to gather logs detailing how these agencies manage other FOIA requests. These ne…
articles.title: Coinbase Files Dual FOIA Requests Demanding Transparency On US Crypto Crackdown

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: On Monday, U.S. spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) marked another day of gains, pulling in $294.29 million in positive inflows. In contrast, ether ETFs saw a different story, losing $20.8 million across nine funds during the trading day. As Bitcoin ETFs Surge Again, Ether Funds See $20.8M in Outflows According to sosovalue.xyz metrics, the 12 […]
articles.title: Massive Inflows Push Bitcoin ETFs Higher as Ether Funds Falter

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
In a recent interview with journalist Madison Reidy, Michael Saylor, CEO of MicroStrategy, stirred a massive controversy within the Bitcoin community with his remarks on custody and regulation. The discussion centered around the risks associated with large institutions holding significant amounts of BTC and the potential for government seizure or confiscation, reminiscent of historical events like the gold confiscation under Executive Order 6102 in 1933.
 
When questioned about the risks of having a significant amount of BTC held by third-party custodians and large institutions, Saylor dismissed concerns of increased seizure or confiscation. He argued that BTC is safer in the hands of regulated public entities like BlackRock, Fidelity, and JP Morgan than with unregulated private holders. S…
articles.title: Michael Saylor’s Latest Remarks Shock The Bitcoin World: What He Said

articles.title: CoinDesk 20 Performance Update: HBAR Drops 3.5%, Leading Index Lower From Monday

articles.author: Oliver Knight
articles.description: Layer-2 network Scroll released its long-awaited native governance token on Tuesday. Traders have priced SCR at around $1.10, or a $212 million market cap, based on the circulating supply figure of 190 million.
articles.title: Scroll's SCR Token Debuts at $212M Market Cap in Volatile Trading Session
